title: Firefox is blocking every search.
content: Whenever I attempt a search, no matter what the topic, I get blocked. A page comes up that says "Malware and Phishing. This site is blocked because it is a known security threat. Please contact your network administrator to gain access." I deleted Firefox and re-downloaded it, but it's still blocking me.
creator: gracetravelr

title: Unable to use firefox with amazon
content: Firefox won't allow me to use my PW on Amazon. I called Amazon CS and they told me it was a problem with Firefox. While I continue to use Firefox I have to switch to Edge to go to Amazon. Help. It's very cumbersome.
creator: bobmaxwell

title: Bookmarks disappear
content: When Firefox reboots after a Mac software update, our internet Favorites bookmarks are gone. How can we save them, to avoid that?
creator: janekmolony

title: Why is the scrollbar in Firefox changing color on certain sites like Youtube?
content:
I have noticed in the last few days that the scrollbar has been changing colors from site to site. On most, it remains a light grey, but on some sites, most notably Youtube, it has turned a darker color, with the scrollbar turning outright black on videos now from Youtube, but only if I'm not signed in. Meanwhile if I'm signed in, it's a darker shade of gray, but not outright black. Does anyone know what's causing this? I will include screenshots, with the scrollbars circled. The first shows the scrollbar in its normal coloration, and the following three showing Youtube, first on its main page, then one with me signed in, another with me signed out, growing progressively darker.

Is this a glitch, or something to do with their coding, or what? If someone can answer this, I'd love to know what I'm dealing with here.
creator: Marc7

title: Problem Setting Firefox as Default Browser
content:
Windows 10 Home 21H1 (in Korean Environment) Firefox Developer Edition 92.0b5 (64-bit), installed in "D:\Program Files\Firefox Developer Edition", linked directory "C:\Program Files\Firefox Developer Edition" to installed path

1. When I choose the default browser app in Windows settings, It displays Firefox twice. https://user-media-prod-cdn.itsre-sumo.mozilla.net/uploads/images/2021-08-19-19-10-04-f5ef95.png

2. I selected either of them as default browser, but Firefox settings displays that it's not selected as default browser. And also "set as default browser" button does not work

How can i solve this problem?

title: File and Bookmarks font has suddenly shrunk
content: Since the last time I opened the browser the commands in the top nav, File, Edit, View etc have all shrunk to about a 4pt font. I see other people have had a similar issue and the answer seems to be along the lines that the font size is a universal and that there is some, somewhat complicated, workaround. But I ain't done nothing! They have just shrunk! What gives and how to I get them back to a readable size please?
creator: tonyrutt1

title: Youtube - Indicador de texto encima los videos
content:
No se como se llama, pero a la hora de reproducir videos en youtube, aparece esa linea parpadeante en la esquina inferior izquierda que normalmente aparece sobre textos para indicar donde va a colocarse la siguiente letra que pongas. Solo la puedo quitar si selecciono algun texto pero si le doy a reproducir el video de nuevo vuelve a aparecer.

No afecta el funcionamiento de youtube y hasta donde se no aparece en otras paginas de videos, pero es lo suficientemente molesta como para darme un toc y hacer que deje de querer ver videos.

Intente iniciar en modo seguro para ver si era algun tema o complemento y funciono un rato pero despues simplemente volvio a aparecer (sin salir del modo seguro ni cambiando nada). Tambien intente borrando y reinstalando todo pero la linea sigue apareciendo y me es demasiado molesta aaaaaaaaaaa

En la imagen medio que se alcanza a ver, welp
creator: justgray.dagr

title: Password manager has flaws.
content:
Firefoxe's Password manager has a flaw. It at times uses names for pw identification. Many sites today uses your e-mail addy for its name. When Firefox sees this it will ask should it update the pw. It doesnt seem to realize that this name is used across many sites. If someone mistakenly updates the pw, you wont know until you log in, which site had its PW mistakenly updated.

How do you disable / fix this feature.

There is also a auto fill in that seem to only rely on the site. This is the repair. If it were to be possible to make firefox use the sites info, it should alleviate the problem of mistaking every email address name on a sites password verification list as the same as evey-other.

Is there a switch for this feature.

thanx,

Jerome
creator: romeemore

title: Pre-load webpage in tab
content:
I am working with a webpage that is very slow-loading. Right now I prefer to open it in a tab and then switch tabs while it loads, then switch back when it is finished loading.

This may work to some extent, but I think even when I change back to that tab it takes Firefox some time to load up the web content in some way and display it, even though the page is not still loading over the internet.

Is there some way I can get the page in that tab loaded actively in the background so that when I switch to it it's completely ready to go, as if it had just been open the whole time? There must be some Firefox setting or command to trick Firefox in a way that that tab is open and active and should be treated as such.

Thanks very much, Julius
creator: julkhami

title: Links won't directly open in Firefox
content: Newly installed Firefox to replace Safari on MacPro. Installed downloaded file which has extension .dmg and Firefox does not appear as an .app. Set it as the default browser and checked permissions. Whenever click a link I receive the error message "The application cannot be opened" 10826, see image below. In order to open a link I have to copy the link and manually paste it in the Firefox search window to get to the link. Driving me nuts, please help. Alex
